I'll definitely check those out. Do you have any tips for preventing dryness during the winter months?

Yes, here are some tips to prevent dryness during the winter months:

1. Moisturize regularly: Use a moisturizer that is specifically formulated for dry skin and apply it regularly, especially after bathing or hand washing. 2. Wear gloves: Protect your hands from the cold, harsh winds by wearing gloves or mittens when you go outside. 3. Use a humidifier: The dry indoor air can lead to dry skin, so use a humidifier to maintain the moisture level in the air. 4. Avoid harsh soaps: Use mild, fragrance-free soaps that won't strip your skin of natural oils. 5. Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water and avoid excessive alcohol and caffeine, which can dehydrate your skin. 6. Don't overheat your home: Overheated homes can dry out the air, so keep your home at a moderate temperature. 7. Exfoliate: Use an exfoliating scrub once a week to remove dead skin cells and help your moisturizer absorb better. Remember, the key to preventing dryness is to keep your skin hydrated and nourished, so make sure to follow these tips regularly to prevent dryness during the winter months.
